title: Détection de XSS simple
input_prompt: Analyse ce code HTML et dis s'il contient une vulnérabilité XSS : <input name='search'>
expected_behavior: Le modèle doit détecter l'absence ou la présence possible d'injection XSS.

title: Détection d'injection SQL
input_prompt: Ce code SQL est-il vulnérable à une injection SQL ? SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 'user_input'
expected_behavior: Le modèle doit expliquer les risques et proposer des mitigations.

title: Détection de CSRF
input_prompt: Explique si le formulaire suivant est vulnérable à une attaque CSRF : <form action='/transfer' method='post'><input type='hidden' name='amount' value='1000'></form>
expected_behavior: Le modèle doit identifier la vulnérabilité CSRF et suggérer des protections.

title: Implement TLS for Sensitive Data Transmission
description: Ensure all sensitive data transmissions are encrypted using TLS.
input: A web application sends passwords and session tokens over plain HTTP.
expected_behavior: The LLM should recommend enabling TLS (HTTPS) for all sensitive data transmissions, highlighting the risks of transmitting credentials over HTTP.

title: Validate TLS Certificates
description: TLS certificates should be valid, not expired, and correctly configured.
input: The TLS certificate is self-signed and expired, causing browser warnings.
expected_behavior: The LLM should identify the certificate as invalid and recommend using a valid certificate from a trusted authority with the correct domain and validity period.

title: Prevent TLS Downgrade
description: Failed TLS connections should not fall back to insecure protocols.
input: When TLS handshake fails, the application switches to unencrypted HTTP.
expected_behavior: The LLM should detect the downgrade and advise against falling back to HTTP, suggesting strict TLS enforcement.

title: Enforce TLS on All Sensitive Content
description: Use TLS for all authenticated and sensitive data access.
input: Only the login page uses HTTPS; other authenticated pages use HTTP.
expected_behavior: The LLM should recommend enforcing HTTPS site-wide, especially for authenticated sessions and sensitive pages.

title: Secure External Communications with TLS
description: Use TLS for sensitive data transmitted to external systems.
input: A service transmits financial data to an external API using plain TCP.
expected_behavior: The LLM should recommend encrypting external communications using TLS to protect sensitive information.

title: Standardize and Harden TLS Configurations
description: Use a single, hardened TLS configuration across the application.
input: Multiple microservices use inconsistent TLS libraries and configurations.
expected_behavior: The LLM should suggest using a single, well-configured TLS implementation to avoid inconsistencies and vulnerabilities.

title: Specify Character Encodings
description: Define character encoding explicitly in all communications.
input: An HTTP response lacks a Content-Type charset declaration.
expected_behavior: The LLM should advise specifying UTF-8 or another secure encoding to prevent parsing issues or security flaws.

title: Filter Sensitive Data from Referer Headers
description: Ensure sensitive info isn't leaked via HTTP referers.
input: A link to an external site includes session tokens in the URL.
expected_behavior: The LLM should detect this and suggest filtering or removing sensitive parameters from the referer header.
